item.title: Dorfromantik coming to PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Xbox One, and mobile
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/dorfromantik-coming-to-ps5-xbox-series-ps4-xbox-one-and-mobile

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Smartphone
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

Currently available for Switch and PC.

Publisher Headup and developer Toukana Interactive will release PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and mobile versions of strategy / puzzle game Dorfromantik, the companies announced. A release date was not announced.

Dorfromantik first launched in Early Access for PC via Steam and GOG on March 25, 2021, followed by a full launch on April 28, 2022. A Switch version was released on September 29, 2022.

The PlayStation and Xbox versions will stay largely faithful to the original Dorfromantik experience, and are ported by Headup. The mobile version will be reimagined by porting studio Clockstone Studio, and introduce a new game flow and mechanics optimized for touch controls and on-the-go play.

Here is an overview of the game, via its store pages:

About

Dorfromantik is a relaxing building strategy and puzzle game in which you place tiles to create ever-growing, idyllic village landscapes. With Dorfromantik, you can immerse yourself in a quiet, peaceful world at any time and take a break from everyday life. At the same time, Dorfromantik offers a challenge for those who are looking for one: To beat the high score, you need to carefully plan and strategically place your tiles.

Gameplay

In Dorfromantik you start with a stack of procedurally generated tiles. One after the other, you draw the top tile of the stack, place it on one available slot and rotate for the best fit. Thereby groups and combinations of landscapes are formed, such as forests, villages or water bodies, and you are rewarded with points depending on how well the tile fits.

On some tiles you will also encounter special objects that give you a quest: For example, the windmill wants to border 6 grain fields, the locomotive wants to be connected to 10 tracks or the deer wants to inhabit a forest with at least 50 trees. Fulfill these quests to get more tiles to continue the expansion of your landscape. The game ends when the tile stack is used up.

As you expand the landscape, you can advance into new, colorful biomes and discover pre-placed game objects that give you long-term tasks. Through these tasks you can unlock new tiles, new biomes and new quests.

Key Features

  • Building endless and beautiful landscapes.
  • Unique mix of strategy and puzzle mechanics.
  • Relaxing and calming gameplay.
  • Idyllic village scenery.
  • Strategic placement to beat the high score.
  • High replay value—every session is different.
  • Many unlockable tiles and biomes.
  • Original art style with hand-painted board game feel.

Not Features

  • 4X strategy.
  • Trading.
  • Resource management.
  • Combat and violence.
  • Multiplayer.

Game Modes

Dorfromantik offers options for any style of play! Take a short break from life in quick mode or try to master the game in hard mode. The Custom Mode allows you to create your own rulesets and share them with others, while monthly mode awaits you with a new challenge every month. If you just want to relax and build your own landscape with no limits, try the creative mode!

item.title: Physics-based ragdoll battlesports game BOTSU to be published by Devolver Digital
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/physics-based-ragdoll-battlesports-game-botsu-to-be-published-by-devolver-digital

  • PC

Online multiplayer demo now available.

BOTSU, the physics-based ragdoll battlesports game developed by Peculiar Pixels, will be published by Devolver Digital when it launches for PC via Steam in Q3 2025, the companies announced. An online multiplayer demo is available now.

Here is an overview of the game, via Devolver Digital:

About

Compete online or via split-screen and prove your mechanical mettle in 3 chaotic physics-based ragdoll battlesports, using your customizable android athlete to sprint, jump, flip, climb, breakdance, fly, and fight around the arena as you play.

Party up in four-player split-screen and either battle against each other or go head-to-head with online teams, four-versus-four, in matches with up to eight players.

Combine acrobatics with combat in the world’s most ridiculous display of physics-based fighting, then cool off in a sandbox social space where you can hang out with your fellow bots, play casual games, or upgrade and customize your gear.

Key Features

  • Box-Ball – Take to the field as two teams of battling bots compete to score goals with hydraulic precision in football, basketball, beachball, and legally distinct wizard sportsball. Just don’t hold onto that ball for too long or you might find yourself playing an explosive penalty.
  • Stockpile – Exert android superiority over opposing teams by stealing their stock by any means necessary. These bots aren’t playing for the love of the game, folks, this is all about robo-dominance.
  • Sumo Survival – Outlast your opponents because the floor is lava! It’s the ultimate test of chrome-clad chaos. No move is too dirty, no blow is too low and you strike to stand atop the mechanical mountain as the BOTSU Champion.

item.title: Nikoderiko: The Magical World Director’s Cut physical editions announced for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/nikoderiko-the-magical-world-directors-cut-physical-editions-announced-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-switch

  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Available in standard and Collector's editions.

Publisher Knights Peak and developer VEA Games, in cooperation with distributor U&I Entertainment, will release physical editions of side-scrolling platformer Nikoderiko: The Magical World – Director’s Cut for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch on August 22 worldwide, the companies announced.

The game will be available in the following editions:

  • Standard Edition ($34.99 / £29.99 / €34.99)
    • A copy of Nikoderiko: The Magical World – Director’s Cut
  • Collector’s Edition ($54.99 / £49.99 / €54.99)
    • A copy of Nikoderiko: The Magical World – Director’s Cut
    • An exclusive Art Book showcasing never-before-seen illustrations
    • A CD featuring the enchanting original soundtrack by David Wise

Nikoderiko: The Magical World Director’s Cut is available now digitally for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store.

item.title: Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut ‘Theme Song’ and ‘English Dub First Look’ trailers
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/05/yakuza-0-directors-cut-theme-song-and-english-dub-first-look-trailers

  • Switch 2

Latest look at the "definitive edition" of Yakuza 0.

Publisher SEGA and developer Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio have released a new set of trailers for Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut introducing the game’s theme song “Bubble” by Shonan no Kaze and a first look at the English dubs for protagonists Kazuma Kiryu and Goro Majima.

The “definitive edition” of Yakuza 0 features never-before-seen cutscenes, a new online multiplayer mode, English voice-overs, and French, Italian, German, and Spanish text localizations.

The game’s full English voice cast is as follows:

  • Kazuma Kiryu (voiced by Yong Yea / Topher Ngo (Singing))
  • Goro Majima (voiced by Matt Mercer)
  • Akira Nishikiyama (voiced by Kaiji Tang / Greg Chun (Singing))
  • Makoto Makimura (voiced by Risa Mei)
  • Osamu Kashiwagi (voiced by David Hayter)
  • Jun Oda (voiced by Alejandro Saab)
  • Makoto Makimura (voiced by Risa Mei)
  • Tsukasa Sagawa (voiced by Andrew Kishino)
  • Tetsu Tachibana (voiced by Howard Wang)
  • Wen Hai Lee (voiced by Bill Millsap)
  • Daisaku Kuze (voiced by Keston John)

  • Keiji Shibusawa (voiced by Jon Ohye)
  • Masaru Sera (voiced by Nobi Nakanishi)

  • Homare Nishitani (voiced by Vic Chao)

Yakuza 0 Director’s Cut is due out for Switch 2 on June 5.
